result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Harlan G Bolgrin Jr. was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall complete AODA assessment and Driver Safety Plan

miscConds.notes: No alcohol possession or consumption of alcohol beverages. Not to enter a bar, tavern, or establishment where primary purpose is the sale or consumption of alcohol.

timeConds.notes: w/Huber.  Sentence to begin forthwith.  Last 120 days to be held in abeyance and used at discretion of PO.
